text:
this would make the [not-so-portable] inhouse-tool
(http://www.mail-archive.com/ant-user@jakarta.apache.org/msg06235.html) obsolete.
Such batch script circumvents the missing stdout redirection in ant or the
missing option required to specify an ouputfile e.g. in gnu m4.
creator: hauser@acm.org

text:
With nightly build 2003-08-27 it now is at least possible to use the outputfile
as a target file, i.e.

<apply executable="m4" output="foo.sql" dest=".">
  <fileset dir="." includes="foo.m4"/>
  <mapper type="glob" from="*.m4" to="*.sql"/>
</apply>

We lose the ability to work on multiple files here, but then again this is what
the output attribute promises to do, it captures the output of a single execution.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org
text:
With the <redirector> in Ant 1.6.2 this issue can be laid at rest.

<mapper id="out" type="glob" from="*.m4" to="*.sql" />

<apply executable="m4" dest=".">
  <fileset dir="." includes="*.m4"/>
  <mapper refid="out" />
  <redirector>
    <outputmapper refid="out" />
  </redirector>
</apply>

should take care of all .m4 files.
